ratings.comment: Steve was a harsh grader and very intimidating whenever I asked for help. He was completely full of himself and only talked about how great of a reporter he was. Don't take this class!!!

335 with Walters has been one of my favorite classes at UW. He has a ton of experience in writing and broadcast, which is extremely helpful. He helped our class score press conferences with Barry Alvarez, Chancellor Ward and Kathleen Falk. Definitely worth waking up early for!

Steve is the best! To me, he's one of those teachers that people attribute to inspiring them to finding their true calling in life. I really would try and take 335 with him, I might go as far as to say that it's not worth taking 335 without him.

Although Steve is an engaging and earnest teacher, his focus is political reporting, and it seems like he may be rooted in one version of the trade. It's good thing he called in guest speakers from other areas of journalism, or I would recommend they change the name of this class to "Journalism According to Steve Walters." Nice Blackberry, Steve.
Walters was great. Since he works for the Journal Sentinel, he hooked us up with some cool stuff (i.e. interview with the governor). It's worth getting up early for.

Great professor for this course.   Doesn't overload you, knows his stuff (he works for the journal sentinel, hence the early class), and is a sharp guy in general.  can tend to ramble and seem scatterbrained, but he's all there.  sucks getting up early, but you do get to do better interviews and stories than other sections.

I took his creative non-fiction course a couple of years ago. He is an amazing story teller and a fabulous teacher. He's also a tough editor. Walter's course was one of the most memorable and meaningful courses I've ever taken.

Walters is a REALLY great teacher for 335. He grades you very carefully and fairly. He is stimulating to listen to, even at 8 a.m. (he pushes the 7:45 back 15 min!) He brings in lots of outside materials from the current journalism world so it makes it really relevant.
